channel.title: Changing the Music Industry?
channel.description:
Blink 182 Guitarists and Vocalists Tom Delonge Shocked blink fans across the world in February 2005 by ending the band blink 182. The reason he decided to call it quits is because he simply didnt want to do it anymore. Tom Delonge wanted to mature with his music, he wanted to do something different with music (he didnt want to be immature talking about fucking dogs). He actually wanted his music to make a impact, so he started a new band AVA (angels and airwaves), made a website (modlife). Why he did this I kept wondering, What is in this guys head? Im a big fan of tom myself so I decided to dig a little deeper into this mystery.
Tom Delonge after breaking up with the band walked into a studio and said "I want to change how music is made, I want to change how its produced, I want to change the music industry". People did not take him seriously, they were like arent you the guy in that band who runs around naked? After creating his new band and releasing 2 albums Tom is Finally getting his respect. Angels and Airwaves will be releasing a album called "love" on valentines day this upcoming year and also releasing a movie as well. This will be the first ever movie released by a band.
The interview below is brilliant. I personally thought he wasnt this smart.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvvGFYmXGOs&feature=channel
What is your guys thoughts? Do you believe music will actually be like this ? (in the interview)

item.title: Changing the Music Industry?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Speljohan:

Music industry will continue to be shit as long as money is involved.

And this is the very reason why less-popular/underground artists/genres aren’t shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Music Industry?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

They released some remasted Beatles albums in the UK and the boxset cost about £180!!

I’m seriously tempted to vote for the pirate party in the next election, but maybe I should vote for something more sensible…

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Music Industry?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The fat-cats at the top of the music industry need to learn their place already. I’m just glad that people are sticking it to them by not paying for the music.
Nine Inch Nails is another band that’s against the way the music industry currently operates, although with respect to their pricing. Trent Reznor told people to steal the Year Zero album because he was disgusted with how much the Universal Music Group was charging for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Music Industry?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:21, topic:301118”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=397409.msg2952924#msg2952924 date=1252646051]
However, I believe something has to change, because the music industry blows right now. I haven’t heard any decent music that was made after 1972 or so. (possibly a few, but not many)
[/quote]

Do you realise people were saying that in 1972? And in every other year, because its a recurrent cycle.

In 10 years people will be raving about the songwriting masters of 2009, and how much they wish they could come back to this time.[/quote]

I agree with this.

Read full topic

item.description:

anyways, do you guys think this a good direction music is going in?
[/quote]

Music isn’t going in this direction. Just because 1 guy, albeit famous, tries something doesn’t mean anyone else will do it.

However, I believe something has to change, because the music industry blows right now. I haven’t heard any decent music that was made after 1972 or so. (possibly a few, but not many)[/quote]

1 guy with the idea, but a number of bands have already started going in this direction, but the idea goes to him.

item.title: Changing the Music Industry?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:8, topic:301118”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=397409.msg2951564#msg2951564 date=1252540075]

blink 182 sucks

This isnt about blink182. This is about tom delonge and his idea with the music industry how music shall be free (like tv). But bands will sell there merchandise (like u watch simpsons and u wanna go buy a simpsons shirt). He talks about how technology has a impact on music and how his goal is to change the way music is marketed.

@goatee

Yes this will be the first movie from a band thats not a documentary or anything. Usually band movies are about the band, AVA however is taking a little different. Making a real movie.
[/quote]
since when is tv free?[/quote]

TV is use to be free, all you had to do was buy a television. Its like radio, you buy a radio and u listen to the stations u want. But for the future since people just dowload music illegally, music should just be handed out for free. But how will artists make it? They will using a website with membership, or selling there merch

Read full topic
